value:
I will see the waves aflame! All shall
flee before my coming—and what is
left behind is mine to take!

Piracy is unheard-of in Múspell...
If only for the simple reason that
I incinerated all who defied me!

Weaklings are ill-fit for piracy.
A festival like this may be suitable
even for the citizens of Múspell.

One must have sufficient strength
to live free of others' restraints...
What else is there to being a pirate?

My daughters could hardly believe
their eyes seeing me like this.
...I fail to see what is so shocking.

Come and join the pirate festival—but
do not expect that you will survive to
see another sunrise!
I will consume the waters with flame!

A diversion perhaps, but I will not
hold back! The sea's floor awaits
the weak!

Hm... Battle at sea seems to require
a different tack...

Power is the treasure worth seeking,
and we will never have enough!

I am Surtr, king! This festival will
be burned away until only a sea
of raging flame remains!

You may be one of the few with
any strength—yet you do not act
as such.$k$pThe powerful must dominate and
take what is ours by right. It is our
obligation. Pirates understand this.$k$pA pirate festival is a mark of culture.
I see no matter more deserving of
celebration than taking by force...$k$pFree of all restraint, the pirate takes
the seas by storm... Such a life would
suit me well.$k$pNow, we are obligated in turn to
return to the festivities—and take
everything we can carry!
Reckless!
不敬！
ぐっ…
Impudent...
I'll take it all!
Wail louder.
The seas take you!
Blood comes in waves!
Ridiculous!
Ha-hahaha.
I, Surtr, king of Múspell, drawn into this farce...
Do you not know? To touch me is to die.
I care not if it is the ocean. I will set it all ablaze.
I wish for the flames to grow hotter still!
The strong take from the weak. That is the order of things.
It has been a long time indeed since Múspell saw a festival.
Serve me, and we will take everything there is to take.
Yes.
Victory is on the wind...
To the bottom with them.
